cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 190 mi (310 km) SW of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: Henri is expected to continue west for another day, then curve north on Friday and accelerate toward southern New England over the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England (Long Island/Block Island Sound vicinity)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coastline from the Outer Banks of North Carolina northward to New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts generally 20–30 mph Sunday into Monday if the track trends west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the Delaware River/upper Delaware Bay area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1–2 inches of rain Sunday–Monday; locally higher totals possible if Henri’s track shifts farther west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey and Delaware beaches late week through the weekend.
